source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，婆伽婆在跋耆城名阿耨風。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Bhagavān was in the city of Vṛji called Anavatapta.

source_sentence: 彼時，世尊從下晡起，告尊者阿難曰：「汝，阿難！
translation: At that time, the World-honored One rose from his seat and said to Venerable Ānanda:
Come, you!

source_sentence: 當共至阿夷陀婆池水上，當共澡浴。」

Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼時，世尊與尊者阿難及隨從比丘，俱至阿夷陀婆池水上。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān, Venerable Ānanda, and the monks who followed him went up to the water of Ajitabha's pond.

source_sentence: 到已在阿夷陀婆池水岸上，脫衣著水岸上，在阿夷陀婆池水澡浴已，出在水上，
translation: Having arrived there, he was on the shore of Ajidhava’s pond. He took off his clothes and put them on the water’s shore. After having bathed in the water at Ajidhava’s pond, he came out and remained deep in the water.
On the water's shore, he wipes away the water with a bowl and removes it.

source_sentence: 彼時世尊告尊者阿難：「阿難！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Venerable Ānanda, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 有放逸者禘婆達兜，失其處當墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，難可救。
translation: If someone is careless, they'll fall into a bad destiny if they lose their place in Upagupta, and they'll live in a mud plow for an eon that's difficult to rescue.
You, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 豈不從一比丘聞此言耶？」
translation: Didn't you hear these words from a monk?

source_sentence: 「我記禘婆達兜當墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，難可救。
translation: “I predict that Ābhāsvara Bodhisattva will fall into a bad rebirth, and it will be difficult to save him if he remains in the mud plow for an eon.

Yes, Bhagavān!
Haven't you heard this?
Bhagavān!
I heard these words from a monk.
“What do you think, venerable Ānanda?

source_sentence: 世尊知禘婆達兜意之所念，所行邪偽，以餘方便知耶？
translation: Bhagavān, do you know what Upagupta thinks and what he does? Is there any other way to know the error or falsity of his actions?

source_sentence: 而今世尊一向記，此禘婆達兜當墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，難可救。
translation: Now, the Bhagavān has always predicted that this Cundadatta will fall into a bad destiny and live in a mud plow for an eon, which is difficult to save.
This, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 所從比丘，或上尊、或年少，或下比丘少智慧，而如來有所說，彼而疑。
translation: The monks from whom they came were some of the highest rank, some younger, and some of the lower rank had little wisdom. But when the Tathāgata taught something to them, they doubted it.
Why is it so?
Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我亦不見天及世間魔梵、沙門婆羅門、眾天及人，我如是所記墮惡趣，
translation: I do not see gods, worldly Māras, Brahmās, renunciants, brahmins, gods, or humans.

source_sentence: 泥犁中住一劫，難可救，如禘婆達兜。
translation: It's difficult to save someone who lives in a mud plow for an eon, like the gandharva.
Why is it so?
Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我一向記禘婆達兜墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，難可救。
translation: I've always remembered that Upagupta fell into a bad destiny and stayed in a mud plow for an eon, which is difficult to save.
This, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我不見禘婆達兜有白法如毛髮；
translation: I do not see any white dharmas like hair in the polar mountain.

source_sentence: 若見者，亦不一向記禘婆達兜墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，難可救。
translation: If someone sees it, they don't always remember that Upagupta fell into a bad destiny and stayed in a mud plow for an eon, which is difficult to save.
Therefore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我不見禘婆達兜有白法如毛髮，是故我一向記禘婆達兜墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，
translation: I do not see that the white dharmas of Jambudvīpa are like hair. For this reason I have always predicted that Jambudvīpa will fall into a bad rebirth and remain in hell for one kalpa.
It's difficult to save.
It's like that, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 離城村不遠有大廁，滿中糞，或有一人墮中，沒身不現。
translation: Not far from the city or village there is a large latrine filled with dung. Someone may fall into it but their bodies do not show up.

source_sentence: 或有人作是念憐愍之，欲有饒益，欲拔濟彼，欲令安隱，在彼大廁上周旋視之：『此人頗有不污處如毛髮者，
translation: “Some people have this thought of pitying the man because they want to benefit him. They want to rescue him and wish to make him at ease.
I'll take them and pull them out.'

source_sentence: 彼在大廁上周旋視彼人，無有一處不污如毛髮者，而令彼人可拔濟之。
translation: He looked around at the man in the great latrine and saw that there was not a place where his hair didn't stand on end, but he told him to pull it out.
So it is, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我不見禘婆達兜有一白法如毛髮者；
translation: I don’t see any white dharmas like hair in the polar mountain.

source_sentence: 若有者，我不一向記禘婆達兜墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，難可救。
translation: If you do so, I won't always say that it's difficult to save someone who falls into a bad destiny in Jambudvīpa and stays in a mud plow for an eon.
Therefore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我不見禘婆達兜有白法如一毛者，是故我一向記禘婆達兜墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，
translation: I do not see any white dharma like a hair on the body of Ābhāsvara. That is why I have always predicted that Ābhāsvara would fall into evil destinies and remain in nirvana for one kalpa.
It's difficult to save.

source_sentence: 於是，尊者阿難眼墮淚，叉手向世尊，白世尊曰：「甚奇，唯，世尊！
translation: Then Venerable Ānanda, with tears falling from his eyes, saluted the World-honored One by placing his palms together [in respect] and said to him:

source_sentence: 而今世尊一向記此禘婆達兜墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，難可救。」
translation: Now, the Bhagavān always remembers that this person in Jambudvīpa fell into a bad destiny and stayed in a mud plow for an eon, which is difficult to save.
“So it is, Ānanda!
So it is, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我一向記此禘婆達兜墮惡趣，泥犁中住一劫，難可救。
translation: I've always said that this person in Jambudvīpa will fall into a bad destiny, and it's difficult to save him from abiding in a mud plow for an eon.
You, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 當從如來聽，分別大人根相，當增上於如來有信樂，意歡喜生。」
translation: You must listen to the Tathāgata and discern the characteristics of a great person's faculties from the Tathāgata, who will increase faith in the Tathāgata and rejoice when his mind arises.

source_sentence: 於是尊者阿難叉手向世尊，白世尊曰：「今是，世尊！
translation: Venerable Ānanda then saluted the Bhagavān with his palms together and said to him, Now, Bhagavān!
At the time, when it's well cut off, please, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 為諸比丘說分別大人根相。
translation: He explains to the monks the distinguishing characteristics of the great man's faculties.

source_sentence: 從世尊聞已，此諸比丘當故。」
translation: After hearing it from the Bhagavān, these monks will die.
Ānanda!
Listen.
You should remember it well, and I will explain it for you.
Yes, Bhagavān!
Venerable Ānanda accepted the teaching of the Bhagavān.
The Bhagavān told him, Here, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如來知一人意之所念，此人與善法俱、不善法俱，此如來於後時知意之所念行，
translation: The Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of one person’s mind. That person is endowed with good qualities and bad qualities. At a later time, the Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of that person’s mind.

source_sentence: 此人善法滅不善法生，此人善法滅得不善法，已有善根不斷絕，於此善更當得善。
translation: This person's good qualities cease and unskillful qualities arise, and this person ceases the good qualities and attains unskillful qualities, has good roots that don't stop, and will then attain goodness again with these good qualities.

source_sentence: 如是此人為至意清淨法，猶若，阿難！
translation: Thus, this person's intention is to purify the Dharma, just as if he were, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 日欲出時，所有暗冥皆悉滅盡便得大明。
translation: When the sun was about to rise, all the darkness and darkness would cease, and then he'd attain great luminosity.

source_sentence: 彼日出已，欲至食時，所有暗冥皆悉滅，便有不明不？」
translation: When the sun comes out and they're about to eat, all the darkness and darkness will cease, so isn't there something unknown?

“So it is, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如來知一人意之所念行，此人與善法俱、不善法俱，彼如來於後時知意之所念行，
translation: The Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of one person’s mind. That person is endowed with good qualities and bad qualities. At a later time, the Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of that person’s mind.

source_sentence: 此人善法滅不善法生，此人善法滅得不善法，已有善根不斷絕，當更得善法，
translation: That person’s good [dharma] will cease and bad [dharmas] will arise. That person’s good [dharma] will cease and they will attain bad [dharmas]. Those who already have good roots will not be cut off, and they will again attain good [dharmas].
Thus, this person's intention is to purify the Dharma.

translation: The Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of one person’s mind. That person is endowed with good qualities and bad qualities. At some point in time, the Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of that person’s mind.

source_sentence: 如來說大人根相，如是如來法法所趣等悉了知。

source_sentence: 如來知一人意之所念行，此人與善法俱、不善法俱，此如來於後時知意之所念所行，
translation: The Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of one person’s mind. That person is endowed with good qualities and bad qualities. At some point in time, the Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of that person’s mind.

source_sentence: 如來知一人意所念所行，此人與善法俱、不善法俱，彼如來於後時知意之所念所行，

translation: The Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of one person. I do not see anyone who possesses wholesome states like hair on his head. Such a person is addicted to evil and unwholesome states.

source_sentence: 還有苦熱之報，受生老病死，如是此人身壞已生泥梨中。

source_sentence: 如來說大人根相，如是如來法法相生等悉了知。」

translation: The Tathāgata may know the thoughts and actions of one person, but that person is accompanied by unwholesome states or wholesome states. At some point later, the Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of that person’s mind.

translation: That person’s unwholesome state ceases and wholesome states arise. That person’s unwholesome state ceases and they attain wholesome states. Those who already have roots of unwholesomeness but do not cut them off will again attain wholesome states in relation to those wholesome states.
Thus, this person's dharmas will cease.

source_sentence: 有火燃而燃自然而燃，或有人復著乾草木著中者，於阿難意云何？

source_sentence: 如來知一人意之所念所行，此人與不善法俱、善法俱，此如來於後時知彼意之所念所行，
translation: The Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of one person. That person is accompanied by unwholesome states of mind and wholesome states of mind. At some point later, the Tathāgata knows what they are thinking and what they are doing.

source_sentence: 如來說大人根相，如是如來知法法相生，定悉了知。

source_sentence: 如來知一人意之所念所行，此人與不善法俱、善法俱，如來於後時知彼意之所念所行，
translation: The Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of one person. That person is accompanied by unwholesome states of mind and wholesome states of mind. At a later time, the Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of that person’s mind.

translation: That person’s unwholesome state ceases and wholesome states arise. That person’s unwholesome state ceases and they attain wholesome states. They already have roots of unwholesomeness that are not cut off, and all will be cut off.

source_sentence: 有火燃而燃自然而燃，或有人取火著乾地，或著石上，於阿難意云何？
translation: What do you think, Ānanda? If someone were to take a flame and put it on dry ground or on a rock, what do you think?
Would the fire burn much?
“No, they won’t.
Yes, Bhagavān!
“So it is, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如來知一人意之所念所行，此人與不善法俱、善法俱，此如來於後時知意之所念所行，
translation: The Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of one person. That person is accompanied by unwholesome dharmas and wholesome dharmas. At a later time, the Tathāgata knows the thoughts and actions of that person’s mind.

source_sentence: 此人不善法滅善法生，此人不善法滅得善法，已有不善根不斷絕，一切皆當斷絕，
translation: That person’s unwholesome state ceases and wholesome states arise. That person’s unwholesome state ceases and they attain wholesome states. They already have roots of unwholesomeness that are not cut off, and all will be cut off.

source_sentence: 如來知一人意之所念所行，我不見此人有黑行如毛髮者，此人一向滿善法、善行、善報，
translation: The Tathāgata knows what one person thinks and acts. I do not see anyone with black conduct like a hair, who has always been perfected in the practice of virtuous qualities, good deeds, and good rewards.

translation: The body is associated with a good place, and thus this person should attain parinirvāṇa in the present life.
It's like that, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 有火滅，涼冷無熱，或有人以乾草木著中者，於阿難意云何？
translation: What does Ānanda think when a fire goes out and someone puts dry grass or trees in it for coolness and no heat?
How could you get a fire?
“No, they won’t.
Yes, Bhagavān!
“So it is, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如來知一人意之所念所行，我不見此人有黑行如毛髮者，此人一向滿善法行善報，
translation: The Tathāgata knows what one person thinks and acts. I do not see anyone like a hair on my back who acts in black, whose mind is always full of virtuous deeds that bring good rewards.

source_sentence: 如是此人現法應般涅槃。
translation: Thus, this person should attain parinirvāṇa in the present life.
So it is, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如來說大人根相，如是如來法法相生，等悉了知。
translation: The Tathāgata teaches the characteristics of the great person's faculties, thus are the characteristics of the Tathāgata's teachings and dharmas produced, and they are equally fully known.
This, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 謂初三種人，彼一人有清淨法，二種人有滅法，三種人身壞墮惡趣泥犁中。
translation: It means that the first three kinds of people have pure dharmas for one person, two kinds of people have cessation dharmas for two people, and three kinds of people fall into the mud plow of bad destinies when their bodies break up.

source_sentence: 謂後三種人，彼一人有滅法，二種人有清淨法，三種人見法應般涅槃。
translation: These are the last three kinds of people. One person has the doctrine of cessation, two kinds of people have the doctrine of purity, and three kinds of people see the doctrine and should pass nirvana.
This, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我已說大人根相，如世尊應為弟子慈愍有饒益，我已為汝說。
translation: I've already explained the characteristics of a great person's faculties, just as the Bhagavān should be compassionate and beneficial to his disciples, and I've explained them for you.

source_sentence: 今當在靜處、樹下坐處，當禪思，莫放逸，莫於後時變悔。
translation: Now, while you're in a quiet place or sitting under a tree, you should meditate and contemplate, don't be careless, and don't change your mind at any time later.
This is what I teach, and this is what I teach.
The Buddha thus explains it.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞世尊所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Having heard what the World-honored One said, those monks were delighted and remembered it well. ****** 13. The Scripture on the Explication of Underlying Meaning:
Foshuo anuthou wen jing
